Reviews.Title: “Paris stop over”
Reviews.Author: tikkalikka
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights while passing through Paris 3/23 - 3/25, 2012. The location was great with the Metro close by for easy access to central Paris, and the village next to it was teaming with people enjoying food and shopping. Great! My room was large, so was the bathroom, both clean. Bath robes were a bonus. Lighting was dim and it was difficult to see even with all lights turned on. The reading light next to the bed was high density, a potential fire hazard (my pillow almost caught fire). I had a window that could be opened, others were not so lucky. All in all a nice business hotel for groups.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, in a good area of Paris”
Reviews.Author: Andrew P
Reviews.Content: The hotel was good, and the room was a decent size. The hotel is on the edge of Paris, and very near Bercy Village, which looks like a redeveloped market. There are some nice bistros and bars there, and we enjoyed an evening out there. At the hotel, when when we first arrived, the window in our room wouldn't close. While they let us move rooms, which was great, it was surprising that they were offering that room to guests, as it was very noisy with the window open. The other slightly negative comment was to the paper cups for drinks in the rooms, which as another review said did cheapen the image of the room. Overall though, I would recommend the hotel if you wanted to stay on the outskirts of Paris. Otherwise, I'd consider staying more centrally.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great hotel”
Reviews.Author: jizuan
Reviews.Content: It was a pleasant experience at Pullman hotel @ Bercy but definitely not the best Pullman hotel we have stayed in. Personally we find the room abit dim for our liking day and night. Plastic cup was provided instead of glass which kind of cheapen the brand itself. Room is big. Hardly see rooms that big in europe. So that was a plus. The spread for the breakfast was good. Service was average as the staff looks grumpy most of the time. Overall, it was one of the better one we have stayed in in europe.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Michael V
Reviews.Content: The ambiance at réception is very zen. The rooms are very quiet, and the staff always greet you with a smile.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and very nice services”
Reviews.Author: Khalidme
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best places you may enjoy business and amazing very close restaurant. the rooms are very good and the joiner suite is excellent

Reviews.Title: “Just a good hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Halimbalo
Reviews.Content: This is a really good hotel in the south of Paris. You can easily travel into Paris with the tube which will only take you some 15 minutes, running every 3-5 min. The rooms are clean and well equipted. The staff is helpfull and speaks english. Across the road you find the Bercy village were you have several restaurants in a cosy athmosphere. By far the best hotel at a reasonable price I know in Paris. I would always come back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: VespaGrrl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel at the beginning and end of a group tour. If you want rustic, and Central Paris, this would not suit. However, it is a Very Short metro ride into central Paris (and it felt really good to be able to navigate the metro so easily). The concierge is endlessly helpful. The staff, A1. On my last day I was absolutely exhausted, so ordered room service. The food and coffee were piping hot and delicious. The hotel is spotlessly clean and modern - I did like the aromotherapy scent as you come through the main revolving door. The free access to PCs was a bonus. The rooms were spotlessly clean. The beds DEVINE! I did eat out a couple of nights at the Bercy Village, which is very conveniently located 2 minutes stroll away, but found the food and service very ordinary. BUT, the cafe there was superb - the BEST coffee. Great little shops at Bercy for browsing and buying. Monoprix is there and has very well priced clothes and accessories, if you have forgotten to pack something. Sephora have the most delightful staff, and beautiful makeup and perfumes. I found the breakfast at the hotel to be more than adequate. Yes, a bit pricey, but I loved the fresh fruit. And it is very convenient. As I was with the tour group, we were in the big "Downstairs" breakfast room. Many people were grumbling that the escalator was out of order, and they were not happy with walking up the stairs to get back to the lobby area. It's worth noting that the escalators start up as yet step to them. They do not run all the time. :0) My one bit of advice if you are staying here with a tour group is, if you are arriving before 3pm, to book an extra night at the beginning of your trip. I always book the night before I'm due to arrive so I can check in immediately. It's not a lot of fun arriving at 10am (after 30 hours of flying) and being told you can't check into your room until 3pm. Just make your arrival time clear to the hotel, so that they won't give out your room the night before, thinking you are a No Show.

Reviews.Title: “Stay no place else !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: xanthe890
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 7 nights in may of 2011. Hotel lobby and rooms are very modern and clean. Staff extremely helpful and efficient. All questions were greeted with a smile and you could see that they genuinely try to helps even though there i serious language barrier.Very close to all the shops and restaurants in the heart of bercy village, as well as to the Cour St Emilion Metro 14 line. This hotel is beyond excellent for the price and though not in the center of paris it is close to a metro that can get you any where in the city in less than 20 mins. Only negative is that they charge you for ice (5 euro) if you get it through room service even though it i sfree at bar( I did not know this at the time)

Reviews.Title: “Functional and modern, well-located, excellent services”
Reviews.Author: Macocean41
Reviews.Content: We had a very good stay of one night (w-e) in this hotel very well-located just nearby Cour Saint Emilion which is a kind of small and trendy "village in town" full of nice shops, bars and restaurants, besides also a huge complex of cinema, and close (5' walk) of the famous automated LIne 14 of the subway which is probably the fastest way to reach the heart of Paris (in less than 10'!). The service was excellent, in particular thanks again to the concierge (Steven) who was very helpful and amongst other, succeeded to organize a reservation in a "fully booked" theater (through an agent and with an additional but acceptable fee (10EUR)) where we had excellent first choice places which we could not have obtained through the usual booking sites. The food of the restaurant of the hotel is acceptable but not exceptional. The service again very pleasant. The room :when we entered it, there was a small fusty smell (smoke from the previous guest?) but the room was clean with the expected comfort and equipment of a 4star. In particular, the bed was excellent. We will come back again to this hotel as we are used to spend and enjoy w-e in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Good Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Senegade
Reviews.Content: The rooms were great and the staff were very helpful. The breakfast is overpriced for the options available (25 euro per person). It is close to the Cour St. Emillion metro stop which made it very convenient to get to the center of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great location....Bercy Village was more than what we expected. Really nice shops, restaurants, and a Starbucks. Metro was really close to get to with kids. Less than 10 minutes to the Louvre area. Hotel breakfast was too expensive at 25 Euros/adult, but places to eat near by. Top notch service, valet parking no more expensive than parking yourself. This was wonderful with the kids to pull up to the door and just get out. Clean hotel, and as always.......awesome beds!

Reviews.Title: “Solid but uninspiring”
Reviews.Author: rialto11
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a three night stay. The staff was remarkably pleasant and accommodating, the rooms were clean and quiet, and everything worked. On the other hand, the hotel has no personality, the restaurant was mediocre and completely lacks character, and the service in the bar was slow, with weird decor. But it works if you have business nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Bel hÃ´tel mais peu de charme”
Reviews.Author: Philippe1380
Reviews.Content: Bel hÃ´tel moderne et bien Ã©quipÃ©. Beau hall et trÃ¨s beau bar. Quartier sympa et agrÃ©able. TrÃ¨s bonnes communications vers le centre de Paris grÃ¢ce Ã  la ligne de mÃ©tro 14 (mÃ©tros trÃ¨s frÃ©quents).

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but not very central”
Reviews.Author: SNP127
Reviews.Content: Pullman Paris Bercy is a good clean modern hotel but was not as central as implied. Access to central Paris was good by the underground but not too suitable for late night return. Room smelt of smoke despite non-smoking policy. Otherwise was clean and bed comfortable. TV quality was poor and English channels mainly news and BBC News disappeared in the morning. Also had a tendency to be controlled by remote control from other rooms!! Overall slightly sole-less and not helped by clinical location.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location for a Paris City Break”
Reviews.Author: Linney01
Reviews.Content: We visited Paris for four days over New Years Eve and this hotel helped to make it a great holiday. The location is great and feels a safe and close walk to the metro station which has frequent trains into the centre. Bercy Village itself had a number of lovely restaurants and small shops to browse in.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel for a decent price”
Reviews.Author: fleagah Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Pullman Paris Bercy is on the whole a clean hotel that smells very nice. The staff are generally pleasant and helpful (although maybe more so than others). The best thing I would say is the location. If you are not looking for a city center hotel, then this is the perfect place to stay. It is located on the relatively new and clean number 14 metro line (at station Cour Saint-Emilion), and is just a few metres away from 'Bercy Village', where there is a small alley of restaurants and small shops. There is also a grocery-type store (monop), and a large cinema nearby. There is a taxi station just by the side of the building. As for the rooms, the beds are clean and comfortable. The TV has a selection of foreign language channels, though as another reviewer wrote, the English ones were mainly news-type, eg BBC, CNN, CNBC. The breakfast was quite nice. The only thing missing, perhaps, was fresh salad. (There is fresh fruit, but no vegetables.)

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel but not remarkable”
Reviews.Author: wolfman50
Reviews.Content: Pullman Bercy is a fine hotel and I have no hesitation in recommending it to others, especially if a good B+B price deal can be obtained either from a booking site or preferably in direct contact with the hotel. Nevertheless there are some issues that for me put it on the level of a "Novotel plus" rather than a truly high end remarkable hotel (these do exist in the Pullman brand and in Accor as a whole) and that is too bad since we had higher expectations after staying at the Pullman Skipper in Barcelona. The hotel is located outside the historical center of Paris, but is very accessible by Metro line 14, that relatively quickly hooks you up to major lines like no. 1 at Chatelet. The Metro station itself is within 5 minutes walk of the hotel, adjacent to the nice Bercy Village pedestrianized shopping and dining area. Automobile access is also very good from the Peripherique or the Quai road along the Seine. This of course depending on the traffic situation which was more or less jammed throughout the main arteries of the city almost all day. If you are just touring the city, avoid using a car at all costs, the Metro is your best bet. Valet parking is available in front of the hotel as well as at a 24/24 parking opposite. Prices are equally expensive (around 28 euros per 24 hour period), but this is par for the course in Paris. As at other Pullmans, the public areas, with emphasis on the lobby, is very modern and attractive. The staff overall is professional, helpful and polite, but some are more so than others. When the concierge noticed that I was having trouble using the airline on-line check-in kiosk in the lobby (a very useful and nice touch in itself), she immediately offered effective assistance and solved my problem. We arrived at the hotel after 14:00, the official check-in time, and our rooms were not yet ready, even though we had reserved long before. Just as hotels rightly insist on check-out at or before the official time so that rooms can be made ready for the next customers, so they must have the room ready when the customer arrives after the publicized check-in time. Apologies were offered and arrangements made so that after a short wait we were given rooms. This is not a tragedy, but it is nevertheless irritating to arrive from a long flight and have to wait. The rooms are relatively spacious for Paris, nicely decorated and clean. The inner door separating the entrance from the living space and isolating you from noise in the corridor or a loudly showering partner as you sleep is a very useful idea The queen size bed is as comfortable as it gets. There is sufficient closet and shelf space as well as a large in-room safe. On the other hand, our sons were in a so-called triple room - a queen sized bed and a convertible sofa bed. The sofa bed, as is usually the case, was unfortunately much less comfortable than the main bed. Apparently the hotel does not have twin bed rooms (2 equally comfortable beds) or we were not offered such a room and this diminished the sleep and overall experience (after all what do you do most of the time in a hotel room other than use the bed). The rooms are equipped with flat screen TV sets offering a wide variety of channels in myriad languages - the English language channels are all of the 24 hour news type. A great plus is the free wifi available in all the rooms The bathrooms are also quite large for Parisian hotels and supplied with a selection of Pullman's wonderful orange scented amenities. It's too bad that the sink, bath and shower facilities are closer to the Novotel standard than that which we expected of Pullman. There is only a single sink for what is billed as a triple room and a lack of shelf space for customers' toiletries. The bathing area is a very simple bath/shower combination with the simplest of shower heads. There is no hand hold available when standing under the shower. This combined with the lack of a no-slip shower mat (of which I'm no great fan), makes slipping in the tub a distinct and dangerous possibility. Hotels of similar standard usually offer separate walk-in showers with advanced "rainfall" shower heads. Pullman Bercy is not for aficionados of the great hotel bathroom! Housekeeping needs to run a tighter ship so that amenities are replenished in sufficient quantity for the number of guests in the room. The hotel offers a varied and adequate breakfast. The room itself is large, reflecting the size of the hotel, with a reasonable overflow area. At the same time the main table and side counters are insufficient for a "full house", which was (happily for the hotel) often the case during the week that we spent there. The somewhat harried staff had to work hard to keep up with demand as different food trays were emptied and had to be quickly replenished. This seems to me to be a planning failure. I would expect a Pullman brand also to offer a greater variety of cheeses (the glories of France), There were no soft cheeses (Camembert, Brie), no blue cheese, etc. The breads were good, but again, a greater selection is called for. Above all, there wasn't a single fresh vegetable to be found for a breakfast salad (the wilted tomatoes on mozarella don't count). Hasn't Pullman heard about the benefits of fresh vegetables? I could go on and on, but the point is that you get the feeling that breakfast variety and quantity was decided upon by the cost sensitive accountants rather than by the chef. This may well be true at many hotels, but it shouldn't be so obvious. None of this should prevent you from using this hotel - there are much worse out there purporting to be high end hotels. It does mean that we expected more of Pullman and I think that the management should too.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: vinket
Reviews.Content: In line with all other europian hotels, it's basic things that you can expect and nothing more. Cehck in and check out takes long time as there are only two desks. Housekeeping is unsupervised, so you may some some facilities every day. Conceirge was different from rest of the staff and was quite helpful. One among many choices.

Reviews.Title: “Always welcome”
Reviews.Author: Marc R
Reviews.Content: I am coming sins about five years to this hotel an it is just something you can't miss in Paris. The hospitality is the key word, the personal of this hotel is typically what you looking for When it come to business, leisure and on spot traveling. The area is located alongside of the river Seine 20 min walking distance to the historic centre.

Reviews.Title: “Private Indoor parking”
Reviews.Author: EricRob Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The weekend reduction got lost in the high rate of the private indoor parking. In addition, the car was put outside in front of the main entrance of the lobby. I had asked and have paid clearly for a private INDOOR parking and did not get what I have paid for. At a rate of 58 euro for 48 hrs, I think the hotel must comply with their advertised promises. When I made the remark to the receptionist, she referred me to the belman, the belman minimized the remark as if it was irrelevant: fine if you say so but this way, I see no reason to ever return.

Reviews.Title: “Lazy staff”
Reviews.Author: MJH31
Reviews.Content: I have not personally stayed at this hotel but had to courier a package to a guest there, a sizable box which you couldn't possibly overlook. When I emailed to confirm the guest had received it, the lady on reception said they had not received a box for anyone (it took her three hours to respond). I then emailed her the confirmation of it, who signed for it and at what time. Two hours later she said "we have got it". I had to spend three hours sorting this out as the staff couldn't even be bothered to move themselves to find it, a very poor show in my opinion from a hotel that must have a lot of business clients.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: WaTerBaBy58
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel...roomy, nice decor, clean, fun lobby. Hallways to rooms could use updating, but the rooms themselves were quite nice and large. Breakfast buffet was more than ample and food was pretty good all in all. Breakfast buffet area is like a huge convention room though, just lots of tables and people in tight quarters. Not too much ambience there. Had a nice internet lounge but we couldn't use the "European keyboards" which had all the letters in different places than what Americans are used to.

Reviews.Title: “AS USUAL WITH ALL HOTELS, CLEANERS DO NOT REPORT PROBLEMS”
Reviews.Author: davidhit Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel suffers from a problem common to all hotels: defects in the room had not been reported by the cleaner or room inspector and/or were not acted upon. In this case the much touted TV service did not function properly, a light was burnt out in the bathroom (the main one), the shower screen was badly fitted and water went all over the floor and the air-conditioning was too cold and culd not be adjusted by the thermostat in the room. But apart from that, it was a good hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Senssational hotel”
Reviews.Author: LostDoctor
Reviews.Content: From the minute you check in to the minute you check out, the whole experience was thoroughly enjoyable. Lovely and friendly staff, grand entrance into the hotel and fantastic rooms. The restaurant is very good but it is the breakfast that makes this place, in terms of food. Would highly recommend this place and will most certainly be going back at some point!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable & stylish”
Reviews.Author: GorillaFoot
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel - a lot. It is very conveniently located in Bercy for all the amenities as well as being quite easy to get to from central Paris and CDG airport. Rooms are very comfortable and quite luxurious with a huge and really nice bed. I liked the separate door that you could close off as well inside - always a good touch. Breakfast is also very enjoyable - especially the croissants/pastries as you might expect. All in all a really good quality stay - Andy Murray was staying here whilst playing in Paris - I think that probably says enough.

Reviews.Title: “Very good service and hÃ´tel status”
Reviews.Author: Joaofilip
Reviews.Content: We have bene staying there with 2 rooms for 3 adults and 1 kid Service is great. Open and welcoming staff Location is next to very nice place full of shops and restaurants. Still if you want to use it as a base to visit Paris by mÃ©tro you need to plan long trip back from the centre with several connections. HÃ´tel is definitely not cheap but quality is there

Reviews.Title: “Service was amazing xxx”
Reviews.Author: anitacobbina
Reviews.Content: I have to admit the staff went out of their way to make my stay comfortable. The staff spoke good English and were extremely helpful. I would stay here again and yes I would recommend to friends and family. It is a great location underground is only a steps away and the trains are very fast . If you are to travel around for a few days or station to station then buy the book of ten single tickets you can share them if there's two or three of you it's only 12.50... Great value xxx

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, very convenient to the metro & central Paris”
Reviews.Author: dreese1
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a weekend visit sing Priceline (having selected central Paris and 4 stars as my criteria). The Pullman Bercy is very new, with excellent and large rooms. Business class hotel that exceeded my expectations and the price was unbeatable. Bed was comfortable and room was very quiet. Upscale bathroom. Staff were very courteous. It's located about a 4 min walk to the metro (No. 14 line) and 2 min walk to the Bercy village for lots of restaurants and shops and a good supermarket. Free wifi was a great perk. Rooms also have free Evian and sparkling water daily put in your mini-fridge. Nice toiletries plus a robe and slippers. It was so convenient, yet removed from the chaotic noisy bits of central Paris. I highly recommend this property and would definitely stay there again. I ate breakfast once in the hotel because it was too early for the nearby restaurants. The breakfast buffet was only ok. I probably wouldn't do it again (22 euros).

Reviews.Title: “An excellent place to visit Paris”
Reviews.Author: BachinBaltimore
Reviews.Content: Though this hotel is located in the suburb of Bercy, a Metro stop is within one block, making this a convenient hotel. This is a luxury Pullman, so the price is expensive (this is the only reason I rate it "Very Good"), but to be fair, I don't know how it compares to the area and is probably in line with local luxury hotels. Across the street is a shopping area with stores and many restaurants to choose from. We loved coming back from a long day in Paris and finding restaurants easily. Our package included breakfast, but it was plentiful, and enough that we weren't hungry until mid-afternoon. We were there during a heatwave (82 degress in Sept.!), so the a/c was weak (but bearable), but it was probably like that in all the other rooms. This hotel caters to business travelers (a convention center is several blocks away), but is also perfect for families and couples. This is the second time we've stayed at this hotel for a Paris vacation, and we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room. helpfull staff. would recomend”
Reviews.Author: Ashleyjola
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel overal. walking distance from metro and bercy village, a place of several affordable restaurants. friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: John K
Reviews.Content: We came to thePullman Bercy as part of a GLobus tour and had a great experience. Rooms were very comfortable and especially The beds. Staff is helpful and nice! They all speak well english and try their best to help you. The only problem was the the air conditioning which did not work well. Hotel is a bit far but The Bercy village is a pleasant area.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: anonymous3HI
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located little outside the city but there is a subway station very close by. Quiet area outside of the busy city. There is a small shopping village nearby. Hotel is very clean and the rooms are spacious. Bathroom is also very spacious and clean. Excellent service - staff there always friendly. Concierge good but one especially (Julie) was just excellent. Provided us with accurate, easy to follow directions to get to all the places we wanted to see. She's also very willing to help you with any problems you might encounter. We enjoyed our stay in this hotel tremendously. Highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Would never stay there again”
Reviews.Author: kersan
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Hotel with Insight Vacations Bus tours. Its location is not good, quite a long way from the tourist part of Paris. I found the English spoken to be very good but found ALL the staff to be extremely unhelpful and sometimes quite rude. If I had an issue they would pass me off onto someone else and that went on and on. Nothing was ever resolved, nobody was ever remotely interested. For 2 days I complained that the telephone in my room was not working, and it was still not working whrn I checked out. The same with the airconditioning. Did not work and nobody was remotely interested in fixing it. Mine was not the only room within the Insight group where the air was not working, and like me, the others who complained were just simply ingored. On top of all this, they charge like a heard mof wounded bulls for everything. I rated this Hotel well below some of the 2 star hotels I stayed in and would never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience”
Reviews.Author: Bob M
Reviews.Content: Room is confortable staff is friendly and helpful . We enjoyed breakfast . Good location near Bercy Village . very close from thÃ© subway so easy transportation to visit Paris. we Will recommand this hÃ´tel to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Warm friendly and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Maria K
Reviews.Content: I am a frÃ©quent guest at bercy and always look forward to recuperate after a long flight. ThÃ© room is confortable clean and homely. ThÃ© rÃ©ception is friendly and fast. ThÃ© food is excellent. ThÃ© hÃ´tel is close to thÃ© underground and easy access to all of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice close to gare de Lyon”
Reviews.Author: Londonsense
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival I was greeted very courteously and quickly gained access to the room. Room was very spacious and functional, and the bed comfortable. Despite being close to a major artery, the acoustic insulation worked well. Breakfast was alright and check out smooth. The location is not great from a convenience perspective but access to the metro is good, with a station within a minute's walk. Walking to Gare de Lyon would take you less than 15 minutes. In low traffic Gare du Nord is less than 20 minutes away by taxi. Value for money is alright, slightly on the expensive side. I would definitely consider going back.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Kimplo
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Pullman Bercy and there were some problem on house keeping, thus I've called to reception desk 3 times and met person in charge of house keeping 2 times in 2 nights of stay. I understood that problems could happen, but what makes me angry is the attitudes they've shown to us. It seemed that no one concerned my claim as serious, and no one said his/her sorry about dirty towels and not cleaned room. I can not agree this is 400EURO-4star hotel. 1. Room is very spacious. 2. Traffic noise outside hotel was comparable with airport hotel. 3. Wi-fi was free and quite fast. 4. Although I had to pay 29 EURO for parking, it was convenient and safe. 5. The foie gras delivered for room service seemed like a fast food. Very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: SpikeDallas
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nites on an escorted tour with Insight Tours. My room & bathroom were very large & comfortable, except for very poor lighting. The hotel has taken the green philosophy to extreme, using energy efficient bulbs in every light. Bathroom had usual hotel hair dryer that you had to hold down the button to keep it on. The bathroom electric outlet would accommodate only electric shavers, so if you wanted to use a different hair dryer, you could use it only at the desk. :( The location was OK, a little further away from the sights than desired. Breakfast buffet was good.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend stay for special occasion”
Reviews.Author: harleydavidson
Reviews.Content: From my other posts you will see that I only comment if the hotels are either poor or very good This hotel is certainly very good and above expectation. Great weekend, Bercy is an excellent location for short trip easy to get bus or metro to just about anywhere. However DO NOT LEAVE your wallet or other valuables in your pockets On the metro or bus, I did and within 10 minutes of getting off Eurostar a pick pocket stole My wallet whilst in my front pocket, where I wrongly thought it safe. Beware you have been warned. Keep you money etc in luggage, or keep your wallet on a chain. Returning to the hotel, very clean, was surprised to have seen other comments on this forum Indicated otherwise. Room fantastic bed just about the most comfortable ever sleep on, very close to Bercy Village with many excellent restaurants. Breakfast very good and helpful attentive staff.

Reviews.Title: “First time in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Booklover48 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for the final night of our guided tour of northern France with a major tour company and then booked another two nights to explore Paris on our own. We should have had a queen bed for the two additional nights, per our online booking, but the desk clerk said we would be staying in the same room assigned to us through the tour company. The two twin beds, which seem to be the norm in Europe, seemed a bit lopsided but we slept ok. The hotel and room amenities are very nice, but for the price, they should be! We are accustomed to having clocks of some kind in hotel rooms in the US, but found this not to be the case in Europe. Some hotels had clocks built in to the TV, but the one at Pullman Bercy did not. Minor detail, but it would have been nice to see the time at a glance. The breakfast buffet was varied and fresh, but pricey. You have to look at it as a convenience to justify the price. The PC available requires the hotel guest to sign on and then there is a one hour limit, which is reasonable. The PC's were often in use. We liked the option of an "American" keyboard, tho it didn't work properly for some reason. We took advantage of restaurants at the nearby Bercy Village and also caught the subway from there; that somewhat offset the inconvenience of being further away from the main tourist areas. A cab ride to CDG cost us about $80; don't know if that's reasonable or not, but it seemed high.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Time in paris”
Reviews.Author: T O
Reviews.Content: I come for a l'oreal meeting, which took place at thÃ© very Nice pullman hÃ´tel. ThÃ© hÃ´tel team and thÃ© hosting was excellent ! i recomend!!

Reviews.Title: “Wish I could have stayed longer”
Reviews.Author: barneyrez
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel the last night of an escourted tour. The hotel is beautiful, and the decor in the rooms is very nice. I slept with the window open at night, and had no issues with noise. I was only here one short night, but I wish I could have stayed longer. Staff was very friendly and helpful getting me a cab the next morning. Plan on going back to Paris, and hope to stay at this hotel. BTW - I am a single woman, and was on this trip on my own.

Reviews.Title: “good international hotel that could be anywhere in the world”
Reviews.Author: Deborah D
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a good solid international hotel that could be virtually anywhere in the world. It certainly is not in a good position if you want to feel, or be part of, Paris. You will need to access public transport or taxis if you wish to visit any of the famous landmarks or features of Paris. The hotel is situated in a remote area with a 'village' nearby - a tourist meal area in reality. If you only stayed at this hotel you would never understand the real joy of Paris. The beds are a great feature, but not enough to miss Paris for. The reception is an interesting experience.

Reviews.Title: “slightly upmarket business hotel”
Reviews.Author: pgwswth
Reviews.Content: Smart, clean and functional. Posh decor justifies the high prices. Fine if you can charge it to expenses. typical business hotel rooms - at least you can open the windows but the road outside is noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Hotel, Incredible Value”
Reviews.Author: NijiLagos_Nigeria
Reviews.Content: Was on vacation stayed in 5 star hotels in Cairo, Sharm El Sheikh and Atlantis Dubai, by far the hotel that took our breath away was the Pullman a new 4 star hotel. We loved the room and the rain shower was just amazing it was hard leaving the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “World Class!”
Reviews.Author: Lionroar
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels. Everything was great and the location is in my favorite area of Paris. The restaurant is pricey, as you'd expect, but there are many choices in the Bercy village.

Reviews.Title: “suitably impressed”
Reviews.Author: CaryF
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pullman Bercy as part of an "Insight tour" and I must admit I was not that keen on the idea.The hotel turned out to be excellent....first impressions were good, we arrived early morning after 22 hours of travel from Australia.They gave us an early check-in to a room without any prior notice, even though we were happy to fill in time in Paris until a room would be available.The room was large,modern,clean and had a nice view to the river Seine. The staff were very helpful and the breakfasts up to the usual good hotel standard, the best breakfasts tend to be from a cafe or restaurant, but the hotels are more convenient. We surprisingly found the "Bercy" area to be quite good...it seems modern and very vibrant & almost village like, with many cafes /restaurants etc and unlike the "Opera" area (where we also stayed post tour), clean and not full of beggars and pungent toilet smells.The rail station is close by and is a good less congested line into the city, which is 3- 4 stops away (10mins). The hotel and area are well worth a look if staying in Paris as value for money of the hotel was excellent and if you don,t need/want to stay in the centre of the city, it is only a short trip in and the vib of the area was great.

Reviews.Title: “The Pullman is amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: Lesleyc1959
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay at The Pullman Bercy,we love it hÃ¨re .The location is grÃ©Ã¢t near to a little village with grÃ©Ã¢t restaurants and shops. HÃ´tel is very clean, restaurant great ,breakfast perfect. Would recommend to all. Big thank you to Jean Claude for always looking after us and especially as it was my birthday. We will come back soon . Book a suite if you can they are really spÃ©cial but rooms lovely

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Elbyem_11
Reviews.Content: I'd give this hotel 5 stars, if it were a little closer to the "center" of Paris, and if our (included) breakfast had been a bit more expansive. It's a bit out of the way, but the hotel makes up for it. This was the biggest hotel room we experienced in the six we stayed at in France: it had very comfortable beds, and huge bathroom. it is clearly more geared to a business traveller (for example, there was a large desk, and a pants press), but no problem with that. The hotel opens onto a street with limited access, so it was quiet at night, even though there is a lovely, lively pedestrian open air mall right next to it, with great unique shops, and many restaurants to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel, Nearby Restaurants, Grocery, Subway”
Reviews.Author: Boy_Scout
Reviews.Content: The Pullman Paris Bercy Hotel located in a quiet area of the city. The hotel is in the same league with a Marriott or Hilton. The great thing about this hotel is its proximity to Bercy Village, a collection of restaurants and shops. Bercy Village is a 3 minute walk from the hotel. One of the shops in the village is a small grocery. The subway stop is also located adjacent to Bercy Village and you can be to all of the Paris attractions in a short period of time. The hotel is also near the river and is about a 20 minute walk to some interesting restaurants and clubs next to and on the river. The only issue we had with the hotel was the room was a bit warm. We had the air conditioning set all the way down and we couldn't get the temperature any cooler than about 75.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel, good location, good service”
Reviews.Author: JSJ2010
Reviews.Content: Great for business trip if you don't want to spend stupid money for a room that you will use for a few hours only. Good room, clean, and quiet 1 point for improvement ie quality of breakfast is below international standard

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: nikitatime1921
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nice. We were on the 6th floor and had a tiny little balcony that was nice to have open at night. Paris weather is so nice and cool. The rooms were clean and the beds were soooo comfortable! The fluffy duvet's were so nice. The beds were soft and nice. The breakfast was great. Simple "American" breakfast. Meats, cheeses, fruits, breads, eggs, bacon etc. The hotel is in a great location and is close to a nice little shopping area with lots of restaurants. We ate at a pub and at the crepe place down on the strip. The pub was great. The crepe place was ok. Very odd foods and I couldn't eat it. The rest of my party seemed to like it though. The hotel had free internet wifi which was great. The rooms were cool and comfortable. The bath tub was very deep and nice to take a bath after a long day of sight seeing. The mirrors were neat as they had areas that were fog free after a hot shower. I would definetely go back to this hotel and to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Family Holiday stay”
Reviews.Author: Janetmay
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights during July. First impressions of the hotel we good and we were not disappointed on entering. Reception staff very helpful, we had arrived early for check in, rooms were avaiable however the downside was that they didnt have a double and triple close to each other so the 'wheeled in a bed' in the second room. Although this was apparently comfortable was a little disappointing. Coffee making in the rooms was adequate for one but not for two and I would have preferred a proper cup/mug instead of the cardboard takeway that was there; the bonus was there was a free mini bar in the fridge including bottled water, fruit juice and diet coke. The rooms were good and our bed was so comfortable it was a pleasure. Housekeeping was good....... all in all a great hotel. As for location it was perfect, 2 minutes walk to Bercy village where you find a small supermarket (remember to look downstairs) and so many restaurants to choose from which are all reasonable priced. Dont be fooled bu the quiet times dueing the early part of the day by 1800 the place is so busy as the UCG cinema is also located there. You will be 10 minutes on the metro to all the main sights. All in all a great hotel which I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, very slow coffe service at breakfast, fast escalators though”
Reviews.Author: colpa
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for the second time (each time 3 nights), overall a good hotel, but waiters in the breakfast room do not seem in a hurry to serve their customers their morning coffee, be prepared to wait 10 to 15minutes, even when the room is not crowded at all and plenty of personnel is available. You need luck with the in-room coffee sevica also, bad quality cardboard cups. excellent escalators, they ara always where you need them. Maybe the escalator manager should coach the waiters ...

Reviews.Title: “Boring”
Reviews.Author: KKK66
Reviews.Content: I can not think of any reason to spend a minute of your Paris stay in this hotel unless you're sleeping. It must be the least interesting hotel I have ever visited. The only thing I will remember is the 12 Euro beer I had in the bar.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great location and the rooms are fine. I had a room at the 6th floor facing the river. Quite a lot of noise from the street. The superior room is very nice but the amenities are not the same standard as other hotels. Ex. the free drinks only include water where the Mercure (same chain) offers water, juices and soft drinks. Same with the coffee - here its just regular instant coffee where Mercure offers gourmet coffee. I find this strange since its suppose to be a better hotel and for sure its more expensive. I will always choose Mercure before Pullman. But this will always be my second choice.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it-great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: jettadog
Reviews.Content: My husband and I arrived early for a tour and stayed at the Pullman Paris Bercy-wonderful hotel near Bercy park and lots of good places to eat and shop-metro right across the way, easy to access. Free drinks in the mini bar and enough room for a bottle of wine,food market next to shops over near Bercy park to buy our own wine and goodies, room service gladly opened our wine bottle. comfy beds and good housekeeping, no complaints at all...Chez Bruno across the street in Bercy Village was great, try the 3 Baby Trout from the Pyrenees- was incredible!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: GoGa53
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a wonderful journey in Paris. Hotel is very nice and people are all very friendly and welcoming. Welcomers are here to help you and advise you(which they did very well) and porters are ery efficient. Reception is a bit slow but everyone was nice. The hotel is a bit far from all activities, but the Bercy Village right next door is a very pleasant area with many cafÃ©s and stores. I highly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: butch-l
Reviews.Content: I stayed here three nights a couple of weeks ago on a brief trip to Paris. The room itself was excellent, with all the amenities. A metro station is nearby allowing easy access to tourist destinations. It is also located adjacent to Bercy Village, which has a number of good restaurants. Internet access available, although I had trouble accessing my email here. Staff is also very knowledeable and helpful. A non smoking facility, which was a drawback for me, but not an inconvenience given the overall excellence of the hotel itself.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: steve420
Reviews.Content: A very good hotel. Drinks and food on the expensive side, but it is adjacent to "Bercy village" which is absolutely the best place for a late night meal and drink with plenty of venues. With the metro station across the road, it is a good base to work from when exploring Paris.

Reviews.Title: “EverythiNg is excellent”
Reviews.Author: GordanaPualic
Reviews.Content: It was my first stay with a dÃ©lÃ©gation, it was a very good expÃ©rience and i Wang to stay a gain. The bed is too confortable. Unfortuntelly rooms are no smoking, so i need to smoke outside. It was an excellent. Rooms are beautifull and service is excellent. Tank you for this stay

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Pullman Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The Pullman Hotel for the 1st time and thought it was an excellent choice. We normally stay in the Saint Germain area but find the hotels too expensive in that area now. There is a metro station close by The Pullman and you can get around Paris with ease. The staff were very helpful and the hotel most comfortable. We plan to stay there from now on whenever we come to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “The best night's sleep you'll ever have...”
Reviews.Author: MrsCLondonUK
Reviews.Content: I don't think I've ever slept so well in a hotel. The bed was so comfortable I could easily have spent five days in Paris in bed. My overall experience of this hotel was good but there were a few downsides: (i) breakfast costs 18 euros - you can pop across the road to Bercy Village and pay 6 euros; (ii) location - was a bit further out than we would have liked and it wasn't until the penultimate day that we realised that there was a fast line (metro 14) which would drop you a block or two away from many of the main sights; (iii) this is a large hotel which attracts mainly business visitors and as such is very busy. On a couple of occassions we had to call a couple of time before we got service. notwithstanding this, I would stay at this hotel again. The hotel is well designed. There's a cool bar, adequate gym and relaxation area, free mini bar, 24-hour room service, spacious rooms (which is uncommon in Paris). However, rooms do not have some mod cons which have become standard in hotel rooms (e.g. i-pod docking station and express checkout).

Reviews.Title: “Poor quality customer service lets down this very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is very nice, well situated, pleasant surroundings. What lets the hotel down is the very disappointing service offered by its personnel. We had to request to change rooms because of the smell of damp in the bathroom, The meal served in the restaurant was shockingly poor, inedible What makes the difference in such instances is the quality of customer service offered, sadly for the Pullman Bercy its personnel's lack of quality customer service will loose prospective regular customers.

Reviews.Title: “Helfull”
Reviews.Author: Morris304
Reviews.Content: Very good hÃ´tel and personel very helfull room very clean thank for everything

Reviews.Title: “A modern hotel catering to Americans”
Reviews.Author: Silvercreeker
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 5 nights in the Hotel Pullman Bercy in Paris. It's quite modern and appears to be relatively new. Included in our tour package was a daily breakfast buffet. They could use some pointers on the "American" aspects of the food. The bacon was undercooked for our taste, and the scrambled eggs were runny. But we discovered the same thing at two German hotels we have stayed in, so I must assume it's a European thing. The hotel is located in a lovely district (Bercy) with nice cafes, shops and restaurants within easy walking distance. There is a Metro stop close by, too. Check-in was my only complaint. We were a group of 34, and it took a very long time. Many of us were given keys to the wrong rooms, although eventually it was all sorted out. When I told the young Frenchman at the front desk that our key didn't work, he checked the computer and then, in perfect English, said "My bad", which was amusing. When using the free computers off the lobby, be aware that the keyboards in France are different than those in the U.S. Letters are in a different order, and "@" takes awhile to figure out.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hotel, friendly staff, relaxing design. Highly recommendable!”
Reviews.Author: jcadavi7
Reviews.Content: This was our first time at one of Pullman Hotels and we were very satisfied with both the service and comfort of the place. The staff were very friendly and helpful and the room very clean, spacious and relaxing. The bed was certainly very comfortable and without any smell at all (bleach or detergent) which made our sleep very nice. The hotel has easy access to a Metro station, which makes the trip to central Paris just a matter of a few minutes. In addition there are also a few nice places to eat or drink in the surrounding area. The only small thing we found a bit confusing had to do with the TV. For some reason it kept turning on automatically even though we turned it off with the remote. Our solution was to disconnect it since we didn't want to use it after all. All in all we would highly recommend this hotel for either leisure or business. Our stay was absolutely great.

Reviews.Title: “Could be better”
Reviews.Author: larand
Reviews.Content: Whilst the hotel is modern and well equipped it is seriously lacking in the house keeping department. If you pay the money you expect the service!! The tea and coffee making items were not present in our room, the kettle was there though. After convincing the reception staff we had not lost or stolen the 'black box' with the tea and coffee in a black box duly arrived. Great, one biscuit, 2 milk cartons and the tea bags and coffee. Only 2 cardboard cups, come on, trust me with a proper cup. The following day the room was cleaned by the dirty cups were not removed, on the last day we had 2 cups half full with coffee left on the side. The bed sheets were not changed even though there was a spillage on one which was visible to anyone who cared to look. No water left in the fridge either on this day. Whilst this is a perfectly good hotel and you will not be disgusted, I would expect the little things to be done well in France, in this case they were not!! So if are paying a reasonable rate go somewhere that cares a little more.

Reviews.Title: “Once we found Bercy, we loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Eden_on_the_road
Reviews.Content: OK, this hotel is not in the touristy sections of Paris but what a great place! It seems to cater to flight crews and business travelers. It's ultra modern with beautiful marble floors, fountains and an extremely accomodating staff. The breakfast buffet, reviewed earlier on Trip Advisor, was exceptional. It was included in our daily room rate but you could purchase breakfast for $22 EU (that's an expensive breakfast). The hotel is located about 1/2 city block from Bercy Village, a charming collection of restaurants, shops and a Target-like store that we frequented daily - a great place to pick up a salad for dinner or buy gifts or inexpensive clothes. On the west side of the Village is a metro stop - how easy is that? Our bed linens were beautiful, the bath was newly remodeled, the soaps were Roger & Gallet, the internet was free - ahhh, it was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “A nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Paris and we tried to select a hotel near public transportation, with decent size room, and a fair price. After staying at the Pullman Paris Bercy, I think we made a wise choice. The metro stop was just a couple blocks away and we were able to travel to all the major tourist sites easily. We also enjoyed dining in the Bercy area each night. The room was not huge, but had a king size bed, a desk and small sitting area. The bed was very comfortable with nice linens. The bathroom was clean and very roomy. The free wi-fi was a nice bonus. The staff was helpful, but not always knowledgeable. We had requested connecting rooms as a couple of our kids are still young. When we checked in, we were told the rooms were "communicating" rooms, but they were not. We tried to change rooms, but nothing was available. The rooms were side by side, but not what we had expected. If you are looking for an area with a lot of night life, this is not the hotel for you. But if you are looking for a quiet, convenient location at a fair price, take a look at the Pullman!

Reviews.Title: “Pullman Paris Bercy”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel in a much better location than it might look on a map. The hotel is modern, rooms are large and have all the essential provided (including iron & ironing board). Being very close to the Cour St Emillion metro station on Line 14 makes getting into and around Paris extremely easy (line 14 is automated - no drivers - so even runs on strike days). Food is ok but there a loads of good casual restaurants within 2 mins walk which are a much better option. Gym is small but well appointed.

Reviews.Title: “If you are a family of 4 they will require you to take two rooms”
Reviews.Author: Michella N
Reviews.Content: We are traveling with my 5 year old daughter and 11 month old son. When I made the reservation I made it clear we were to all be in the same room. My son is still nursing and is up many times a night to eat. My husband helps at night, so I can get some sleep. When we checked in we were told that 4 people where not permitted in 1 room and we would have to take 2 rooms. We found this to be very upsetting, especially since I had a reservation that stated there were 4 of us and we only required 1 room. Thankfully I had a copy of the reservation on my computer. They gave us the 1 room, but said it was against their policy and they were making an exception. Other then this policy we found the hotel to be a nice travel type hotel. The bed is comfortable and the room size moderate.

Reviews.Title: “BEST BED I HAVE EVER SLEPT IN JUST WONDERFUL”
Reviews.Author: parisbunny
Reviews.Content: Great hotel!!!! The bed was fantastic and was soooooooooo comfortable...... Staff were great and very helpful.........

Reviews.Title: “Big hotel in a good Paris location”
Reviews.Author: DrGuinness
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is not dead in the heart of Paris central - it is located in the suburb of Bercy, which itself is only a short Metro ride from all the main tourist attractions and business centres. Bercy is a newly 'revamped' suburb which has the 'Bercy Village' (across the road from the hotel) which has a plethora of restaurants, cafÃ©s, a cinema complex, and a number of other shops nearby, including a supermarket, convenience store, etc. It is not overcrowded and serves rather well if you don't want to venture into the city, but don't want to stay in the hotel. The Metro underground station is just at the other side of the Village, and would be around 3-4 min walk from the front of the hotel. The Pullman is large and is what one could come to expect from a large chain hotel. The lobby is spacious and houses the rather nice bar, and restaurant, concierge, reception, with dedicated A|Club priority desk, and express Check In/Out and Airline Check in kiosk terminals. The room is your average Accor affair, with modern furnishings. The bed was average quality, bathroom was sufficient, standard coffee/tea facilities, widescreen TV. There was no minibar, but two bottles of water were in the fridge, free-of-charge. What I found a bit disappointing was the tea/coffee cups were paper with lids, which is great if you want to make a quick cup and run off to work, but it's not so nice enjoying one after a long day, nor is it too elegant having to drink wine or spirits out of paper cups of an evening. I understand their motives for providing the take-away cups, however I would have thought a hotel with room charges such as this would be able to provide both take-away cups and proper mugs/glasses, as lesser hotels do. Other than that, my stay was short, and pleasant. Free Wi-Fi.

Reviews.Title: “Good for Business but Ordinary for Leisure”
Reviews.Author: Kongsi-INFO
Reviews.Content: The location is served by the Line 14 Metro (Blue Line). Next to the hotel is a cinemaplex, a couple of restaurants and a mini mart, so it's quite convenient. The hotel has a lobby lounge and a restaurant. During our 3 nights stay, we observed a lot of business travellers and conventions at the hotel. A nice gym on the lower ground level. When we check in, the first room we were allocated were still in repair, they allocated another room to us. The room size is average. Service at the front office is quick but reserved if you don't speak french. The service at the restaurant is a bit slow when we drop by for supper. Personally, I would not mind staying there again for business but I'll try another hotel if I going there for holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Modern chic hotel in Bercy.”
Reviews.Author: Nimrod104
Reviews.Content: The hotel is close to Gare de Lyon and the Seine in the revamped Bercy village. Reasonable restaurants nearby and all very nicely done. My one small complaint is that the room lighting is not that bright to work by in the evening. A minor detail overall as I found the hotel to be very good in all other aspects.

Reviews.Title: “A top class hotel well suited to an American traveller”
Reviews.Author: taucias
Reviews.Content: This hotel offered excellent service and a very high quality interior. The room was of a good size and offered an extremely comfortable bed. The television was widescreen LCD with various language channels including German, British, French, Arabic, and Spanish. There is free WiFi at this hotel and the connection speed was very fast. There was also a refrigerator with free bottled water inside. The hotel staff were very professional and all spoke excellent English, so it is very convenient for business travel. They seemed accustomed to the American way of business and hospitality. The restaurant service was superb - continental breakfast was offered in a buffet style with a wide variety of cold meats, cereals, fruits, breads as well as cooked plates such as sausages, bacon and scrambled eggs. I did not eat dinner there, but the menu looked good. The bar is dimly lit and matches the contemporary styling of the hotel, however as is typical in a hotel of this quality, the drinks were somewhat pricey. The location is good, within walking distance of the metro and with some nice local restaurants and shops in a renovated area previously used to store the wine casks of Paris. It offered a good place to wander as a business man without having to drive or walk after a long flight. There is an ATM close by and a park to jog in if you feel so inclined. It was safe to walk around at night. There is also an English style pub for those wishing for something closer to home.

Reviews.Title: “Very good surprise”
Reviews.Author: Bruno80799
Reviews.Content: The Pullman Bercy (ex Sofitel) was a very good surprise. Very good price for 5 star hotel. Free wifi for 6 hours every day, free soft drinks in the mini bar!! From the 9th floor we had a very nice view on Paris. Breakfast also good. The hotel is near Paris village with many restaurants and near the subway.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, very friendly staff but location not in the centre of Paris”
Reviews.Author: Alexpaiva
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. The rooms are very cost, very clean and very nice design in the all hotel. The staff was very friendly too and really made us feel at home. the breakfast is outstanding and we loved the all atmosphere of the place. If there is a negative point, it would be the location. We had a feeling that we were far from all the centre of Paris and not really where the action is, but for a relax break, this is a jewel! Wifi is VERY expensive too, a free service would really have been welcome!

Reviews.Title: “Merci Bercy!”
Reviews.Author: zannelapl
Reviews.Content: My family and I spent our Christmas vacation at the Pullman Bercy and were all extremely satisfied! The hotel has a modern, elegant decoration, a very cozy bar, spa facilities and a nice restaurant. The rooms are medium in size but very comfortable. All we needed was there! Amazing beds, kettler, tea and coffee, bathrobes and slippers, bath amenities of good quality ( sampoo, conditioner, soaps etc), satellite flat screen TV, internet, mini fridge filled with free water every day and enough room to sit. We had breakfast every day and it was more than satisfying! Breads, jams, croissants (yamm!!) , plenty fresh fruits, choises of cheese, bacon, eggs and many more things, kept us filled all day! The staff were nice, quick check in and check out and the cleaning was spotless in the rooms. The location was so convenient. Bercy is a modern and clean area ( Paris has some very dirty parts), quiet and friendly. Bercy village was so nice to take a walk every night and has some excellent places to eat (Nicolas was the best!). The metro line 14 was so close and it is the newest line, very fast ride to the centre! What can I say, I hope I will come back to Bercy one day!

Reviews.Title: “great location..best hotel ever!!”
Reviews.Author: vega212
Reviews.Content: great location in the heart of bercy village with metro ligne 14... they upgraded our room to a duplex 4 our honeymoon 4 free for 7 nights!! everything was just wonderfull!!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: iandvBelgium
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in the Pullman last April. It was a very nice and comfortable hotel. We' ve booked a family room (booking.com) but on arrival it was not available so they gave us 2 nice double rooms next to each other. The location was good, very close to a metro station and with lots of good restaurants, bars and shops in the neigbourhood. The breakfast was excellent but very busy because the hotel was fully booked. There is an underground parking right in front of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced average business hotel”
Reviews.Author: manolituca
Reviews.Content: I was a bit disappointed with this hotel - the room price was extremely high (even for Parisian standards) whereas the service and the rooms were very average. My room had a funny smell (although the receptionist dod his best to convince me that it was really a non-smoking room). The mattress was not very comfortable, the air conditioning was way too loud and the bathroom could need some refurbishing and decent cleaning. The only thing that I truly liked about this hotel was it's location: not really in the city center (which means that there are also fewer chances to get into a real traffic jam), very close to the Bercy metro station and with a relatively good connection with the highway going to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Modern but impersonal hotel”
Reviews.Author: Natasha09
Reviews.Content: This is a modern and trendy hotel with a beautiful foyer and well appointed, (if a little small) rooms. Beds and pillows were divinely soft making for excellent sleeping after spending many hours site seeing and shopping. Everything was clean although I'm not sure what was happening with housekeeping, leaving multiple bottle of moisturizer every dat but no shampoo or conditioner after the first day. There'd seemed to be a huge number of people staying at the hotel and at least 6 tour groups. Service from the staff was impersonal and although there was nothing wrong with it was somewhat perfunctory. This was particulary noticeable in the tour breakfast room where tables weren't always cleared until more people arrived. The location was good due to the proximity to the station which was about a 10 minute train trip to the Louvre. Train travel being incredibly cheap and safe this wasn't a problem at all although if I was to go to Paris again I would stay closer in. There was a good range of restaurants within 100 metros of the hotel, one pizza restaurant in particular in Bercy Village.

Reviews.Title: “pullman bercy”
Reviews.Author: EdS16
Reviews.Content: the hotel is very nice. breakfast was good. rooms are big. the staff were not o hospitable though

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special but everything you'd need”
Reviews.Author: stefi1970
Reviews.Content: The Pullman Bercy is a good hotel if you want to stay in a confortable quite place at a 10 minutes metro ride from the most popular attractions of Paris. The rooms are not big, but better than most you can find for the same price in Paris. Everything is functional and there are usuful amenities like: tea/coffee in room facilities, free and easy internet connection, minibar, safe box. The bed is great, big (especially for french standard!!) and confortable with a soft duvet and good pillows. The bathroom is nice, with room enough and high quality towels, in addition to "Roger Gallet" amenities. We used the room service and it was good, quick and overall what you would expect from an international standard hotel. We had also breakfast delivered in room and it was pretty good, with delicious yogurth, warm croissants and fresh squeezed orange juice. We would suggest this hotel, especially if you can get the room at a special rate, if you want to stay in a good and quite place avoiding the centre of the city but conveniently located to visit everything. The metro stop is just 3 min. from the hotel and the line is very fast so you will reach the centre (louvre) in 10-15 minutes. Close to the hotel there is also a small nice shopping centre and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “First class business hotel with free Wifi”
Reviews.Author: Andlil
Reviews.Content: Great location, close to Bercy Village with lots of restaurants and shops and easy access to Metro Line 14. The rooms were as expected but the AC was poor and couldn't cool the room efficiently. Free wifi and free Ethernet! Breakfast was very good with French standards, probably the best we have had in France.

Reviews.Title: “Total efficiency for meetings”
Reviews.Author: Out_to_lunch_10
Reviews.Content: Don't go there for the location or the history. It's a business hotel with excellent facilities and high quality accommodation. Everything works and the staff are great. Have become a regular.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: maple_ny
Reviews.Content: Nothing to say really, it was just perfect. The hotel is very nice and modern, the rooms are really comfortable and the staff is very attentive. Good job!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Marc4
Reviews.Content: Its a little hard to get to by car, but once there, its well connected via metro. Rooms are excellent and the bed very comfortable. Staff is excellent as well. Free wifi. ! Its also next to Bercy Village, which is a great place fot shopping and eating out. Great place to stay in Paris

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable bed; great room; good location”
Reviews.Author: JMP59
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at this hotel as the last part of a 3 week holiday in europe. It was very comfortable and located a short walk to a station on the Metro, which was pretty easy to use to get almost anywhere in Paris. There are nice restaurants nearby at the Bercy Village, although the buffet breakfast at the hotel was quite good.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: molebom
Reviews.Content: This is a 5-star hotel at 4-star prices. Yummy breakfast, incredibly comfy room and right in front of the train station. I would go back to Paris just to stay at this hotel again. It was such a pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice service, but maybe lacking in a Paris feel”
Reviews.Author: benyc
Reviews.Content: Pros: Great service, clean room, safe neighborhood. Cons: Had a "Marriott" feel to it which is ok, but a bit cookie-cutter; Bercy is a little out of the way depending on where you want to spend most of your time and this is your first time to Paris ...

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: shallots
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a junior suite which was beautifully furnished. It had a bathroom, bedroom and separate living room. The living room had huge windows which made the room very sunny. Service was as expected. Housekeeping was slow to prepare our room when we arrived so we had to wait over an hour at the bar. But when we had Internet trouble in the room, they were very prompt to send someone up to help. Overall it's a good hotel and I will stay again. Bercy is a great area. The promenade shops and restaurants were great and we ate there a lot. There is also a small park there. A metro station is there so it was easy to get to the tourist areas.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay!”
Reviews.Author: zaphod84
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for three nights and booked it directly via the hotel website. The hotel lobby was generous and the check-in was very efficient and friendly. Our room was on the 7th floor and it was really nice. Both the main room and the bath room had a good size and had an elegant design with floor to ceiling windows. The bed was really comfortable. We booked a rate, where breakfast was included. In general I'm quite disappointed from the breakfast in hotels most of the times. But this time I was really pleased. The buffet was quite big and there was a good choice. Everything tasted really good. Unfortunately there were just two kinds of fruit juices. The breakfast area was never crowded and it had felt quite cozy. The service was friendly and fast. The gym area in the basement is quite nice and has a couple of cardio equipment. One weak point was the bar area. The service was really slow and once we had to leave, since nobody came to our table. But when we left the bar without consuming anything, the waiter thanked us and wished us a nice day... The are around the hotel is very safe and nice. The leisure area Bercy village has some nice pubs/restaurants and shops. If you want to get some rest, next to Bercy Village you cand find the really nice and quiet Bercy Park. Conclusion: Great hotel with really nice rooms and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Wow- what a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: swpalm
Reviews.Content: Although, yes, this place is a little further from central Paris as one might want, but it's well worth the distance. This hotel has everything including free Internet in the business centers, beautiful rooms and great staff. The best part is that there are tons of restaurants and shops just a hop, skip & jump from the hotel in Bercy Village. My sister and several other people with our tour group visited there for meals. The neighborhood is nice and quiet. The bartenders and front desk staff were always so friendly and never once was I not greeted by them.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and Classy in a great location. A*”
Reviews.Author: Birchp1
Reviews.Content: Great location in Bercy. Bercy Village only 2 minutes away with nice restaurants and shops aswell as the Metro (Cour St Emillion). Staff were very helpful at the hotel both on the front desk and restaurant/bars. The rooms were of a good size, well decorated and the bathroom was also very nice. The bed and pillows were excellent, it made us not want to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel, location is not great”
Reviews.Author: LiveLondonWorkParis
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in this hotel many times (primarily as it's near a client of mine). It used to be a Sofitel and was rebranded Pullman a few years back if I remember correctly. The hotel itself is clean and modern and the rooms are spacious and the bed is good. Showers vary by room but most are in good working order (a problem at other Pullmans I've noticed). The only downside is on the upgraded room (Deluxe?) they have a large, fixed "rain" type shower head, I am 6ft tall and I have to bend to get my head under it, they are very low. Staff are by and large excellent and helpful. They do however have a Nespresso machine in these upgraded rooms, a touch that I like a lot. Gym is in the basement and is small but functional with a pointless "rest space" that takes up as much room as the gym at the back. Location is however not great. It is just next to "Cours St Emilion" which features a clutch of tourist trap type restaurants, none of which were great and most of which are expensive. Most locations in Paris offer excellent bistro food in the area for comparatively little money. There are a few restaurants in the surrounding area (notably the Auberge mentioned by another reviewer (busy but good), Cafe Pauline and Sushi Yuki) that are good however and reasonable. The metro is however close to the hotel and a decent line (13, modern, air conditioned and automated). Overall I like the hotel but wish it had a few more local amenities in the surrounding area.

Reviews.Title: “Incompetent Staff, Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: dokodesuka
Reviews.Content: We had a horrible experience in this hotel. We were able to stay in this hotel because it was the hotel included in the tour package we availed. When we arrived, it was too early to check in so we know we have to wait until check in time. However upon inquiry, the receptionist there told us that we were supposed to â€œgroup check inâ€� and therefore, we have to wait for our tour companions before we could check in. After waiting for hours, we inquired again, this time to a different receptionist, and she told us that we can actually check in without having to wait for the tour companions. That sounds logical because the room is actually already PAID. Considering that those receptionists were all too aware that we have been waiting for hours already, they should have enough graciousness to inform us when the room was ready and that we can already stay in the room that we have already PAID for. And of course, one particular receptionist should be sober enough to NOT tell us wrong and misleading information about the fictitious â€œgroup check inâ€�. Whatâ€™s more, the room should have been triple accommodation, but the hotel did not provide an additional bed, or even at least an additional blanket. I would not recommend this hotel because of very poor services and incompetent receptionists.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury all the way”
Reviews.Author: Dispirit
Reviews.Content: The room at the Pullman was exquisite. Lovely colors, top of the range appliances and the biggest comfiest bed. Spacious and immaculate we stayed two nights here at the end of a four week holiday throughout Europe. It was the perfect end. the location is the only issue although the Metro would be close for further city exploring. Across the road is a little village with shops and restaurants as well as a supermarket for goodies. You can see the river from the huge window but as you are on the edge of the city you can see some smoke stacks in industry areas.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great stay here, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: paulwoodh
Reviews.Content: After looking around for a hotel in Paris, we found a special offer for a superior room at this hotel. We were really impressed by the spacious lobby and bar and the nice designer touches. The room was huge, especially compared to another renowned chain where we have stayed. The bed was huge and extremely comfortable. Whilst not cheap, compared to the cost of other hotels in Paris, we thought this was great value. Check in was a breeze and the staff were really friendly. We werenâ€™t sure about the location, but actually with the metro it was a nice easy journey, just 3 stops to Chatelet Les Halles, 4 to Pyramide (itâ€™s also just 2 to Gare De Lyon, close to Bastille which is great for bars). It was a nice quiet area too. We also tried a local brasserie, Lâ€™Auberge Aveyronnaise. It was fairly busy when we got there and became packed with locals later on. The service was still great throughout though and the food was fantastic. I would also highly recommend the aligot, they were masters of serving this, and it tasted fantastic. We would highly recomend this hotel and would definately consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good city hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bogge
Reviews.Content: Good room, good service, good food, close to the metro, close to a shopping center, close to the center, fitness, sauna. What else do you need for a few wonderful days in Paris?

Reviews.Title: “More style than substance”
Reviews.Author: AM&AP
Reviews.Content: On entering the hotel, you are confronted with a wonderful lobby, and helpful reception staff. The room was nice: typical business hotel fare, but with a really comfortable bed, a Nespresso machine and a big flatscreen TV. But then the annoyances started. After having been driving for a number of hours, I wanted to freshen up... and was happy to see a big rain-shower shower. But... the designers obviously don't believe that people over 180cm exist. I'm 196cm and was unable to shower comfortably - even with the shower-head tilted up as much as possible (and then it tended to poke me in the eye (yes, the head is square)). The TV had the most slow and pointless menu system for finding TV stations. Breakfast the next morning was average. Nothing remarkable about the food - except even with an hour left for breakfast service, there was no bread left. We went out for the day, and on returning, I thought I would try the fitness area and sauna. The fitness equipment was OK, but I was most looking forward to the sauna - again designed by someone who hadn't been at a sauna before I think. However, it was nice and hot (but the showers there was certainly not clean to a standard I would expect). But I had to leave after 20 minutes because of the piped music which permeates every corner of any public area in the hotel. Saunas are meant to be quiet, and if there is music, it should be soothing... not this jazzy poppy bland music being played (I wonder how the staff working in the hotel don't go crazy being forced to listen to this all the time). Breakfast the second morning was a disaster. We arrived down at about 9.40 (service ends at 10.00) to find a huge queue of people waiting to get in for breakfast. On asking to speak with the duty manager I was told that they were surprised that so many people wanted breakfast at that time, becuase normally on a Monday guests have breakfast at around 8.00. How was this a surprise I wonder? It's the Monday after Christmas when most people at the hotel were obviously on holiday and are not working. Some manager type woman tried to get people to have breakfast in the bar. When asked what this consisted of, she wasn't able to tell me. In fact it was a juice, a coffee, and 3 mini-croissants. No thanks. In the main breakfast room, there a lot of things had run out (but were slowly being replaced). Except the bread. There was no bread at all, and only when I was finished did any more appear. We spent 2 nights in the hotel. On the first night we parked the car in the public parking beside/underneath the hotel. 24 hours cost 28EUR. On the second night, I parked in the hotel parking (which is just on-street parking and NOT secure), and for an overnight fee, I was charged 25EUR. An absolute ripoff.
