All in all, there were too many negative things about the hotel, that I will not be back, nor will I recommend it to anyone else. - A shower designed for people under 180cm - Sauna with piped music which permeates the whole hotel. - So so breakfast with no bread - Unorganised breakfast room in a peak holiday period - Expensive parking charges costing the same as secure parking underground. There was also no way of making these comments in the hotel, as comment cards were not provided for in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Big room, near to small Mall & 80% Unfriendly Reception staff”
Reviews.Author: Sporean
Reviews.Content: The room is much bigger than other Hotels I have stayed in for the Europe trip. Kettle, tea bags, disposable cups & cover, coffee packs etc are provided. We are told that we have 2 free Evian bottles at the mini bar but we only found one. I told the reception and they said they will give us another one. However, we still didnt received it on the next day. We called up & then we are given one about 20mins later Our stay includes breakfast and we went to the restaurant on level1. I checked out the spray which is pretty good. THey have steamed or boiled chicken meat, eggs, sausages etc the spread is slightly different from the standard american breakfast. THey have slightly more items and unfortunately, we went to the wrong restaurant! If i'm not wrong, breakfast at this place will be abt 22 Euro Instead our breakfast spread is setup for tour groups. The spread is certainly much pathetic than the one at the restaurant. I'm back to the usual American breakfast. The coffee and tea is also set up at the buffet table. Coffee is pretty good compared to other hotels. Note I am not sure how to refer to this type of coffee but its different from those that are machine brewed by cup) Location wise, the hotel is not very near city but it is very near a metro station. This metro station is the coldest I have ever been to. The cold air is simply unbearable @ escalator area. There's also a small mall located nearby (2mins walk). Agnes B, some craft shops, baby and kids shop, Clothings boutique, Nougurts & Biscuits store, restaurants and a rather big 2 level supermarket. They sell clothes, cosmetics, soap etc, foods and drinks and I love it that they close at 9 or 10pm.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby service, not a four star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pardan1
Reviews.Content: We arrived and found a rip in the duvet cover. I also had to clean hairs from the bath before I could use it! We only stayed one night and we were very glad we did as we were woken up at 6am by a continual high pitched noise. We complained at recepiton and they checked our location in the hotel saying that we were near the cleaners lift. That is all they sadi, no apology, no compensation. This hotel is not 4 stars. Ona positve note, the service in the bar was very good with fabulous cocktails!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent business hotel”
Reviews.Author: traveller_constant
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Puilman Paris Bercy many times and it is an excellent hotel for business travellers. It is not in the centre of Paris but is close to the metro station at Cour St Emilion with rapid links to central Paris. It is also a short walk to the quaint and lively Bercy Village area which has numerous shops and restaurants.The rooms are comfortable and very quiet and the service is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, so so location”
Reviews.Author: C0starican
Reviews.Content: Paris is an enormous city with lots of activities and places to visit. It is therefore impossible to point its "center". However, Pullman Bercy is certainly not at that center. It is quite far away from the main tourist attractions. Having said that, it is a block away from the newest Paris metro line (14) which is absoutely great. It is a block away as well from a tiny "village" of shops and restaurants. The hotel is very modern and big. The rooms are really comfortable and large for European standards. The dining room serves a great breakfast buffet. Overall, we recommend this hotel for business travelers and leisure travelers who donÂ´t mind taking the metro to get to the rest of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel! Not a single negative thing to say!”
Reviews.Author: moevso
Reviews.Content: This is a really great place! It's beautiful, conveniently located, quiet, and has excellent service! The bed was ultra comfortable. I really don't have a bad thing to say about this place and I would highly recommend staying here if you have the chance.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Room, very comfortable bed!”
Reviews.Author: stumpski
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated within Bercy village, a lovely commercial centre with cobbled streets which are filled with boutique type shops, cafe bars and restaurants. The centre is next to the metro (Cour Saint Emillion) and it takes 5 minutes to Gare de Lyon and approx. 15 minutes to the main attractions. The hotel itself has a large reception area with a trendy bar and numerous water features in/around the hotel. The room we had was very modern and spacious with flat screen TV. The bed is to die for! Very comfy feather duvet with pillows which you sink into! This hotel is also very quiet which made it very difficult to get up in the mornings! We were a bit concerned that we wouldn't be in the heart of Paris but the hotel is infact ideally situated because you are away from the hustle and bustle but it is still very easy to get and about on the metro. We bought a 2 day metro, RER, tram, bus pass which cost 14euros and seemed good value.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel at nice area”
Reviews.Author: RoninNL
Reviews.Content: This former Sofitel (with extremely comfortable Sofitel MyBeds!) is situated in a nice calm residential/business area. There is free LAN-internet (no wifi in our 9th story room) and free water and sodacans in the mini-bar. The metro is a 5-minute walk through restaurants, shops and a cinema complex across the street (with many English-spoken films) and line 14 is the most modern line with fully automated fast connections to the major hubs (like chatelet), center and stores (Lafayette). Velib bicycle stand is closeby which is defnitely worth a try to explore Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Good transport links, a little far from the centre of paris”
Reviews.Author: Dr_JRJ
Reviews.Content: Went on a 3 day trip with my wife and 6 month old. The hotel is modern (a bit business like), clean and spacious. They let us check in at 10.30 am and were very accomodating. There is free bottled water in the mini bar. The beds are king size and very comfy, the bathrooms are modern and spacious. Room service was very expensive (20 euros for an omlette), the food was however of an extremely high standard. There is a nice bar downstairs and a restaraunt which we didn't try. The hotel is close to Cour St Emilion metro station which is only 10 minutes ride from the centre of the city but it would take over an hour to walk. Overall very nice and definately recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel experience.”
Reviews.Author: Neiko
Reviews.Content: We arrived and they had our reservation wrong. Our room was not cleaned from the last people that were in it. Two ladies came didn't even acknowledge us, checked things off their clip board and left. We did get a new room. The next day we went down and stood infront of the concierge for 10 minutes while she was on the phone. She then got off the phone looked at us and walked outside to help someone who had just pulled up. We left. The next morning we ordered cappuccino's from the french line it was 10 euros and huge great cups of coffee. The next day we order from the english line 17 euros and half the size. We then call the concierge for help. We were put on hold for 20 min and then finally hung up. The last day we were there it was 9am and the fire alarm went off.. We got up got dressed to find out that it was just a practice drill.. We were not told... To top it all off this hotel is not in a great district. It is far from everything and way over priced... GO ELSEWHERE.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Frequent_Traveler001
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Pullman Bercy for two nights, over a recent weekend. This was the final two nights of our week-long trip to France. It was the perfect match for us - the Bercy area is very quaint and convenient. The hotel is located steps from the metro and charming Bercy Village (really just a strip with restaurants and small shops), as well as a very nice park. For this part of our trip, it was nice being outside of the major tourist areas of Paris - we were so tired of the crowds everywhere! As a US traveler, the hotel is what you would expect from any standard contemporary Marriott, Hyatt, etc. in the US. High-speed internet is included (I believe for all guests), and their is a free business center where you can check emails. There are also alot of lounge-like areas to site both inside and out, if you'd like to get out of your room. Overall, we were very happy we selected this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “what a fantastic way to suprise your wife for her 40th Birthday”
Reviews.Author: AldoNO1
Reviews.Content: I took my wife to Paris as a suprise for her 40th Birthday and valentines! What a great choice of Hotel! Everything was perfect-Location next to the intimate and charming Bercy Village, 50 metres from the Metro, gorgeous Bercy park to stroll through when walking into Paris centre. Staff were excellent. The room was perfect, spacious, extremely clean,and had all the mod cons. The Bed was the comfiest bed i have ever slept in! Breakfast was help yourself Buffett, Quality was spot on! I could not recommend this hotel highly enough! Wow 3 superb nights in a brilliant hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Refreshingly modern, spacious, bright, and sufficiently away from the crowds”
Reviews.Author: Carpinteria
Reviews.Content: The Pullman Paris Bercy is a modern, smart, and sophisticated offering in this historic but newly-reconstructed part of Paris. Formerly a sea of small wine warehouses (some of which have been converted into stylish restaurants, shops, and other boutiques facing a pedestrian mall), the hotel, just like the area it is in, is modern, bright, and convenient. Though somewhat of a distance from the charming center of Paris, Metro Line 14 whisks passengers there at in only minutes at high speeds in very modern cars. Iâ€™m not sure Iâ€™d recommend this hotel for someoneâ€™s first visit to â€œromantic Paris, but for the business traveler or savvy repeat visitor to Paris, this is a refreshingly modern (an reasonably priced alternative) to the somewhat worn or overpriced hotels which are found closer to the city center. The lobby is spacious and colorful, the staff are exceedingly friendly and professional, and everything in the room and elsewhere in the hotel was in great working order. Though the room was equipped with large windows, the sound insulation is excellent, and it was a very restful hotel experience. The distance from town can be a bit of a nuisance, but traveling to even the farthest destinations on the Metro (youâ€™ll nearly always have to change at least once) doesnâ€™t seem too long. Iâ€™ve become a bit bored with â€œthe same old Paris,â€� and I canâ€™t afford the nearly thousand dollar a night five stars. This hotel offers a wonderful combination of style, graciousness, modernity, and convenience. You wonâ€™t walk out to the sounds of accordions or greeted with artists in berets, but if you stay at the Pullman Paris Bercy, you will be surrounded with tasteful appointments, an efficient facility, and an eager-to-please and extremely professional staff.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect solution to city break hotel!”
Reviews.Author: tuff_runt
Reviews.Content: I was planning a Paris break for my girlfriend as her Christmas present, for 3 nights over New Years 08. Before I continue writing, I must let you in on a secret... I'm an obsessive planner! I like to know all the details before I go somewhere, so I intend to list all the things I would have wanted to know here for you, so you can make an informed decision. First off, travel from airport to the hotel. We used the taxi from the airport, standard 5 seat car, and it cost 43 euro to the door. I tipped him 7 euro, but apparently this was way above the going rate. It took 30 minutes, and this was at 10pm. If I had known the city already, perhaps the Roissybus to Opera, then Metro system to the hotel would have worked just as well, and been half the price. But late at night, we just wanted to get to the hotel! On arrival, with my shaky french I was worried we'd struggle checking in. Not an issue at all. The desk staff spoke very clear, polite English, and in a matter of minutes we were in our room. Perhaps because I booked 3 months in advance, we were upgraded room type on arrival, which was a very pleasant surprise! We opted not to have breakfast in the hotel.... 27 euro each seemed ridiculous. Instead, if you cross over the road to the Bercy village, there's a Starbucks (within 200 metres of hotel door), where you can get breakfast for two for around 14 euro. Much better option in my opinion. The metro station is beside Starbucks, so you'll be heading in that direction anyway. If you've never used a metro system before, don't worry... The french metro system is incredibly efficient. As we were only there for 3 days, we each bought a "carnet" (a pack of 10 single tickets) for 11 euro 40 each. The ride into Madeleine station was approx 7 minutes (Line M14). So in other words, do not worry in the slightest that this hotel is slightly out of the way... it's extremily accessible due to the great metro system. There are restaurants in the Bercy village beside the hotel (Bercy village is really just a strip of shops and restaurants), but most of these were closed when we stayed. Room service in the hotel is a great option is you're feeling lazy, and the pizzas we had were both big, and very tasty. Erm... what else. The rooms are very nice, with the queen sized bed being very comfy. Our minibar was free for our upgraded room, and was re-stocked every day. Bathrobe and slippers were supplied, and used!!! The free TV channels are limited (CNN, Sky News, BBC News), so we ended up paying to watch Hancock for 12 euro one night. I would say the only thing that let me down was the TV... but then, you're in Paris! Who needs TV?!?! Oh, the TV is a 32 inch LCD, so it's enjoyable to watch. All in all, an excellent experience at this hotel, and I wouldn't think twice about staying again. Same opinion from my girlfriend! Paris is a lovely city... enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “Modern Hotel, good location, a little expensive”
Reviews.Author: dannysherwood
Reviews.Content: a really nice, modern hotel, great sized rooms and a good locatiion for transport and Bercy Village. Interior is very modern and chic, friendly staff and nice touches in the rooms such as hotel chocolates, coffee "to go" in the room, huge very comfortable bed, radio in the bathroom and space to relax without feeling your just in the hotel room. Nice bar and terrace in the lobby too - with a fab free cocktail the weekend i was there!

Reviews.Title: “Should have saved this for last!”
Reviews.Author: virginiatraveler00
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights as part of a guided tour through northern France and this was our favorite hotel by far! It's in a great part of town, away from the busiest parts of town but accessible to the Metro and cool, less busy things to do. The room was so comfortable with fabulous down comforters and overall was a great place to rest our heads for a couple nights. I wish all of the hotels on the tour were this great. I recommend this hotel with no hesitation!!

Reviews.Title: “Gold standard as usual.”
Reviews.Author: lol_and_lol
Reviews.Content: The hotel offered gold standard as usual. The Pullman Hotel and Resort Bercy Paris is getting more and more better on the service and the comfort. I would like to say that this hotel should be a five stars hotel because this hotel provide all the facilities you need. Except a swimming pool. Maybe it's why the hotel is not a five stars standing hotel. Bercy is lovely you have a Starbucks coffee, a typical italian restaurant, american, cinemas...

Reviews.Title: “Great Midweek break”
Reviews.Author: SW20_Zebra
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a great Midweek stay at the Pullman Bercy at the begining of August. We were looking for somewhere comfortable just for one night before catching a train to Venice the following evening. The hotel is easy to get to from the Metro (about 5 mins walk) and being one of the newer lines were able to use escalators to get to street level rather than dragging heavy cases up steps. The hotel was conveniently situated close to the attractions of Bercy Village, a pedestrianised block or two of resturants and niche shops. We didn't try any of the local resturants but they seemed to be popular with the locals although they did look a little on the pricey side. Because we only had about 36 hours in the city we didn't spend much time in the area but headed off to the main attractions nearer the centre of the city. Some people mentioned the hotel as being a bit remote but we found that even watching the lights get switched on on the Eiffel Tower at 10 o'clock from the Trocadero we managed to be back at the hotel within 35 minutes. The hotel was very comfortable, the staff friendly and helpful and were happy for us to leave our bags for a few hours after checking out so that we didn't have to drag them round Paris before catching the train in the evening. We also didn't have breakfast. We too throught the E27 price charge was a bit steep but looking around Bercy Village a bit later most places were around the same price for breakfast. On the whole I would go back, certainly mid-week because we got a good rate, and would recommend it for a night or two.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Clean, and Roomy”
Reviews.Author: redtexas
Reviews.Content: The Pullman Bercy (formerly Sofitel) is a spacious, clean, and modern hotel just steps away from Bercy Village. We stayed 4 nights and enjoyed our time at this hotel. Pros: Quiet, A/C, big king-size bed (although we were told queen), fridge, access to metro (Cour St. Emilion stop on purple 14 line - one stop away from Gare de Lyon which is a major intersection), close to restaurants and a few shops. Excellent and very affordable wine store at Nicolas in Bercy Village - also a good restaurant. Get their house brand of wine. Bottle from store is less than 3 euros. Cons: No breakfast cafes, no stand for a croissant and coffee. There is a restaurant at the bottom of the Ibis across the street with a great buffet for 9 euros, but nothing cheap, easy, and quick. Dinner restaurants in Bercy were nice, but lacked some of the charm of the Latin Quarter or Marais areas. Very popular and great people watching. Hotel is perfect for anyone who needs a nice, cool, and quiet room. For some of us insomniacs, this is critical and rare in Europe. We were not any further away from sights than anybody else in the city. Don't fear the metro as the 14 is the newest and fastest subway line in Paris. Yes, it lacks some of that "charm", but we wouldn't have traded our wonderful nights of sleep on our big comfy bed for anything! Booked on Priceline. Paid $140 US/night plus taxes.
